<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 118, 379, 144]]<|/det|>
# Cambridge IGCSE™  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 170, 183, 187]]<|/det|>
## PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 194, 332, 210]]<|/det|>
Paper 1 Multiple Choice (Core)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[782, 170, 905, 186]]<|/det|>
0625/11  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[782, 194, 905, 210]]<|/det|>
May/June 2023  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[814, 217, 905, 231]]<|/det|>
45 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 247, 507, 263]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the multiple choice answer sheet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 277, 437, 293]]<|/det|>
You will need: Multiple choice answer sheet  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[215, 291, 539, 320]]<|/det|>
Soft clean eraser Soft pencil (type B or HB is recommended)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 337, 228, 352]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 354, 880, 522]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- There are forty questions on this paper. Answer all questions.- For each question there are four possible answers A, B, C and D. Choose the one you consider correct and record your choice in soft pencil on the multiple choice answer sheet.- Follow the instructions on the multiple choice answer sheet.- Write in soft pencil.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number on the multiple choice answer sheet in the spaces provided unless this has been done for you.- Do not use correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You may use a calculator.- Take the weight of \(1.0 \text{kg}\) to be \(9.8 \text{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 9.8 \text{m/s}^2\)).  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 549, 220, 564]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 565, 570, 613]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 40.- Each correct answer will score one mark.- Any rough working should be done on this question paper.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 107, 91]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 885, 92]]<|/det|> The diagram shows a vertical wire carrying a current \(I\) placed between the poles of a magnet. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[354, 101, 640, 247]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 259, 734, 279]]<|/det|> What is the direction of the force on the wire exerted by the magnetic field? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 288, 143, 306]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 288, 250, 306]]<|/det|> from N to S <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 314, 141, 332]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 314, 250, 332]]<|/det|> from S to N <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 341, 133, 359]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 339, 620, 358]]<|/det|> horizontal and at right angles to the direction from N to S <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 365, 133, 384]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 365, 306, 384]]<|/det|> parallel to the wire <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 410, 107, 428]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 409, 655, 428]]<|/det|> What is an advantage of transmitting electricity at a high voltage? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 438, 133, 457]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 438, 240, 457]]<|/det|> It is faster. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 465, 133, 483]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 465, 235, 483]]<|/det|> It is safer. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 491, 133, 509]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 491, 344, 509]]<|/det|> Less energy is wasted. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 517, 133, 536]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 517, 376, 536]]<|/det|> Less equipment is needed. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 561, 107, 579]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 560, 579, 579]]<|/det|> How are positive and negative ions formed from atoms? <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 588, 897, 720]]<|/det|>
positive ionnegative ion
Aadd positive charge to the nucleusadd an electron to the atom
Badd positive charge to the nucleusremove positive charge from the nucleus
Cremove an electron from the atomadd an electron to the atom
Dremove an electron from the atomremove positive charge from the nucleus

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 107, 89]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 890, 89]]<|/det|> Which statement about the random decay of the nuclei in a sample of uranium-238 is correct? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 100, 133, 118]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 100, 920, 134]]<|/det|> The probabilities of an alpha-particle, a beta-particle or a gamma ray being emitted from a nucleus in the sample are equal. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 141, 133, 159]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 141, 801, 159]]<|/det|> The probability of a nucleus in the sample decaying decreases as time passes. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 168, 131, 186]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 168, 920, 201]]<|/det|> The probability of a nucleus decaying in any ten minute interval is the same for all the nuclei in the sample. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 207, 133, 225]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 207, 794, 225]]<|/det|> The probability of a nucleus in the sample decaying increases as time passes. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 253, 107, 272]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 252, 806, 272]]<|/det|> The count rate due to a sample of a radioactive isotope is measured for 80 minutes. <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[358, 282, 641, 454]]<|/det|>

/minutes		count rate
counts/second

80190
